intro: Guatteria sesquipedalis, commonly known as the long-stalked guatteria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Annonaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its fruit is a smooth, fleshy berry that contains multiple seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
